alert.note: Alert for Amite; Pike; Walthall; Wilkinson (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 2:26PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Louisiana and southern Mississippi, including the following counties and parishes, in southeast Louisiana, East Baton Rouge, East Feliciana, St. Helena, Tangipahoa, Washington and West Feliciana. In southern Mississippi, Amite, Pike, Walthall and Wilkinson. * WHEN...Until 430 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 226 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mccomb, Clinton, Liberty, Greensburg, Amite, Amite City, Magnolia, Kentwood, Summit, Centreville, Roseland, Gloster, Wilson, Osyka, Norwood, Montpelier, Gillsburg, Easleyville, Darlington and Felps. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
